Reviews.Title: “Best I've found in Venice”
Reviews.Author: italophile59
Reviews.Content: Been to Venice a number of times, always staying in 3 or 4 star hotels, but this was by a distance the friendliest place I've found. One could be picky and say the bar was a little spartan, and there was no restaurant, but these were minor faults - and anyway there were two more than acceptable restaurants just opposite. As other reviewers have said, the staff, from "top to bottom", just could not have been more friendly or helpful. The palazzo was well maintained, and the great hall on the piano nobile was very impressive. We had a junior suite - which was more like a large room than a suite, but it was perfectly adequate, with balconies over the San Lorenzo canal. For anyone who has read the "Brunetti" novels of Donna Leon, the Questura is two hundred metres to the right! I can't wait for my next trip to Venice....and I shall certainly try to stay at the Liassidi Palace. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: tracey b
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room and a gorgeous setting. The location was in a quiet little square but easy to find and very close to St Marks Square. The staff were fantastic and very helpful.A place to return. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Liassida Palace”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia R
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay, Wev'e been to Venice 3 time now and this is our first time staying in a hotel. What wonderful staff,can't do enough for you and this Hotel is 5 mins walk from San Marco. I would Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Arthur_GM
Reviews.Content: It's been several years since my visit. It was like a second honeymoon. Excellent hotel, very nice service and breakfast. Try the table near the window and watch the channel and gondolas passing by. The interior of the palazzo is impressive. Great hall on the second floor with a balcony. Close to the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel on a small canal”
Reviews.Author: Niv S
Reviews.Content: good location! 5-10 minutes from san marco and the rialto bridge. the closest veperato stop is san zaccaria, and it is a must. it is not a walking distance from the train station with luggage - believe me we tried! 10 minute walk from the stop to murano island (celestia). The hotel itself is located right on a small canal, very romantic place. The breakfast is very good and there are few tables that have a great view to the small canal. The room was very large and comfortable, so does the bathroom. The only problem is the WiFi - you get only 30 minutes free for each day, for only one device (it is an account - can't access from two different devices at once). If you want more time you must pay 6 euro for 12 hours (what we did) or 10 euro for 24 hours. This still lets you use the WiFi from one device at a time, and at the price we pay for the room I think it shouldn't be like that. There are few restaurants, right near the hotel. the food there is fine- nothing more. it doesn't worth spending money there.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Art Deco Hotel in a Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Loulocket
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located so perfectly in a quiet little street just 1 or 2 minutes walk from San Marco Square. You arrive to an impressive outdoor courtyard which almost takes your breath away. The rooms do not exactly look over the water but each floor has an emense, art deco hall way with seating and rest areas where you can look over the Ponti Greci from traditional, large open balconies. My boyfriend was so moved by these stunning balonies that he proposed to me whilst we sat in one, over looking the Ponti Greci with a Gondola sailing under. We upgraded our room but were not disappointed. An amazing duplex bedroom with an emense Super King Bed and Jacuzzi Bath. No real view but as we had the ballroom like communal area outside the bedroom so we were not unhappy. Infact the large communal area on each floor was always quiet and peaceful so it was like extended bedroom space! A lovely breakfast spread too with continental breakfast but also bacon & eggs. The breakfast area itself was rather dark but you had a level view with the water outside whic made it really peaceful & authentic. We will be returning to this hotel. Amazing value for money for an authentic, grand Italian hotel with a perfect central location to walk across the whole of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: skymark
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel to stay in. Location is excellent - close enough to walk everywhere and far enough away for the hustle and bustle. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was always sparkling clean. All the staff were fantastic - helpful, polite, pleasant at all times. We arrived by private water taxi at eleven o'clock at night. It was so easy to get there. The taxi pulled up at the dock in front of the hotel, rang the bell and someone came out and got our bags. Our room was ready and waiting and the desk clerk was most helpful and charming. The staff helped with maps, directions and reservations at the opera. Free wifi was a terrific plus for us. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Royal Treatment at Liassidi Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter977
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be the best kept secret in Venice. The location is perfection, about a 10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. The rooms are a nice balance between Venetian elegance and modern luxury. After walking around Venice all day, the jacuzzi bathtub is an excellent treat! Breakfast is quite standard, but if you get down early enough, try to snag the table that has a view right on to the canal. The staff were very kind and helped out with really anything we needed. All in all, this is the place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodation and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jendor2
Reviews.Content: Being our first 3 night stay at the start of our tour of Italy, it was a fantastic choice. It was close to the tours we were booked on but far enough away from the noise, hustle and bustle of San Marco Square. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us, providing us with a map and directions to each location we requested and breakfast each day was lovely with plenty to choose from. I did find that most double beds were two singles pushed together and both the beds and pillows in most places we stayed in Italy were slightly harder than what I'm used to but for me its better than being too soft. There was only my husband and I so the room was sufficient, pleasantly furnished and the bathroom was clean and spacious. I had a relaxing bubble bath each night before bed. The room was discretely cleaned, tidied and restocked each day. The staff organised our water taxi to the train station upon departure, which only cost us 70 euro and not the 100 we were told when we approached a taxi driver to enquire. Overall a very pleasant experience and one I would recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like home”
Reviews.Author: pondtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days and could not have found a better place in Venice. The staff made us feel welcome when arriving, asked after our welfare every day, and went out of their way to accommodate us. Our bags did not arrive when we did, so the concierge provided us with information to find what we needed. Liassidi Palace is located on a quiet back canal not far from San Marco square. Our room was large, our bathroom was wonderful and breakfast was good. We own a small B&B so we know what people expect in quality service and accommodation. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but falls a bit short”
Reviews.Author: plkmtk
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi Palace is located only minutes from the tourist over-run San Marco, yet is on a quiet back canal. Also only a five minute walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop.Our room was quite large but the pillows were a bit stiff and I find that plastic cups instead of glasses a rather major fault for a "four star" hotel.Service is proficient but not overly friendly. Breakfast (included) was not up to par. Note that the hotel is superbly located for visitors to the Biennale.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel with very good staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Ng
Reviews.Content: Booked two interconnected rooms for two nights with families. Room sizes are a bit too small. Breakfast is sufficiently good in European 4-star hotel standard. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Location is fine if you would like to stay away from the crowds and It is only about 10 minutes from San Marco Square. Highly recommend to take water taxi (although Euro100 is quite expensive) because it will be a real hassle if you go by vaporettos (public transport) and have to carry your luggages from the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: basi25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in this hotel. We had a junior suite on the 4th floor. Very strange set-up on this floor, a big open space with various "dining tables" that seemed to be of no purpose. We had room 404. Right opposite the room was a closed off area which had all the sheets, toilet rolls etc. The door to this area was open quite a bit so it is a very peculiar view coming out of the room. We were very disappointed with the room. It felt very claustrophobic as there was literally no view. Right outside the room was the wall of another building. Also, despite the air conditioning the room was very hot. Don't think the air conditioning unit is adequate. We failed to see why this hotel is a member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World Chain. It is nice but nothing spectacular about it. The one positive thing was the reception staff. they were very friendly and helpful. Maybe we were unlucky with the room we were given.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to give it a 3,5”
Reviews.Author: Graham M
Reviews.Content: I found it better than "average", but not "very good". A lot of things are right: The location is great. Arriving by water taxi from the airport and stepping direct into the hotel is perfect. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served at tables with a water-level view of the canal (just like on the website). All of that was perfect, and we had a great room (#408); it's called a junior suite, but is actually just one massive room with wonderful canal views from several windows. We booked as members of the Small Luxury Hotels club and got a good rate this way. The children shared a smaller room across the hall, without views. So, what's wrong with it? It's hard to say, actually. Maybe I'm just a bit spoilt, but ... From Google Maps satellite view you see a small terrace with parasols. It's there, but it houses a fat air-conditioning unit, so only the determined smoker will ever put up with the noise to sit outside. Most of the fourth floor is one huge open space with bits of left-over furniture half concealed behind room dividers. You feel like you are walking through some abandoned conference facility on the way to the room. There doesn't seem to be a bar. Part of the breakfast room is fitted out as a bar, but it's not somewhere you can sit and relax during the day or evening, as far as I could see. Maybe it just isn't a very good conversion of a Venetian palazzo into a modern hotel. But we did have a great four days. Maybe it's not easy to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Only Wish It Had Been More Than 2 Nights”
Reviews.Author: LindyLouHB
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. It was stunning and the layout of the rooms around the huge lounge area a unique and beautiful touch. My husband is an early riser so he was able to sit out there with the sun streaming in and read while I dozed in peace. The room was well laid out although didn't like the glass steps leading up to the mezzanine floor, we had to agree if one wanted the bathroom in the middle of the night they would need to wake the other as we would need the lights on to negoiate them. The room was spotlessly clean and the spa bath deep and it retained its water (it was the only one of the 5 hotels we stayed at in Italy which did, all the others drained out while we were sitting in them!). The staff are an absolute asset to this hotel, nothing was too much trouble and they were very genuine with their friendliness and helpfulness. The location was brillant, and we had peaceful and uninterrupted sleep each night. I would absolutly recommend and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else should we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: CYAMADA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-July and absolutely loved this hotel and it's location. In fact, Venice was hands down our favorite City and one of the reasons was this hotel made our stay very pleasant. We rented 2 rooms and our daughters got the suite that overlooked the water. My husband and I also had a room that overlooked the water as well. Each monrning we could hear the boats going up and down the waterways. The rooms were very clean, roomy and spacious and the air conditioning was perfect. Service at the front desk was great and people at this hotel are very service oriented, even carrying your bags to your room and showing you how everything in the room works. We paid a lot more to stay here, but most places in Venice are pricey. The breakfast buffet is also wonderful with lots of things to choose from. Finally, the hotel is less than 10 min walk to San Marcos square and from the water taxis. Very conveniently located. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo08
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi Palace Hotel definitely lives up to all expectations! It is beautifully presented from the minute you walk through the entrance, either arriving by water taxi or foot. We stayed 2 nights (on honeymoon) and were treated to a beautiful bottle of prosecco on check-in. The staff were lovely, very professional and very helpful. It is perfectly located just off the main drag but within easy walking distance to all the main attractions. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice. The restaurant opposite the hotel is to die for and a â€˜must visitâ€™ on your list. The hotel, its location and service really made our trip an unforgettable one. If we get the chance to return to Venice again one day, we will without a doubt be coming back to stay at the Liassidi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: beskardes
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot to the reception team. We felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “So close but far enough away from crowds”
Reviews.Author: earthwalker1017
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, was pricy but for our first trip ever to Italy we wanted something special. Staff was very helpful though at times one must confirm all arrangements. It would be great to have an ATM in the courtyard, changing money does get tiresome when you must pay cash and cannot charge any transport or outside arrangements to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelster22
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel located just far enough off the main drag to be very private and not feel touristy yet not so far that it is still an easy walk to everything you would want to do in Venice. Great breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4 day stay in Venice was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: adventureswithsandy
Reviews.Content: I guess the weather was on our side to start with. Four glorious days of sunshine.The Hotel was wonderful, fulfilling all our expectations and more. Our room had a glass stair to our loft bedroom. Exceptional deco, large modern bathroom and very comforable and compact. Breakfast room was incredible with the reflections of the amazing blue canal seen through original archways.We were provided with a wide selection. Crisp and clean.The foyer was very modern and lead into a lovely courtyard offering lots of outdoor comfortable seeting and ambiance, with an exit to the Venician streets. The large general open area on our floor (3rd) was ornate and modern giving the impression of a grand lounge area with opulant seating areas arranged in a palace ballroom. We took the oportunity to share some Champagne toasts with each other and took some great photos. The Hotel was in walking distance to St Marks Square, quite central to everything. We did all the touristy things like Dodges Palace and Back Street Walking Tour, Rialto Bridge a Gondola afternoon ride which was fabulous, providing us with so much to take in, and a night Gondola seranade along the Grand Canal. We ventured off to Burano on our own via the North Ferry wharf and were blown away with its beauty and villiage charm. We were confident finding our way around and enjoyed the various outdoor cafes choosing caraffs and pizza deals at around E9 each and called into tiny bars enjoying a beer and snacks provided for reasonable prices. Our trip was awsome having booked and prepaid everthing before we left home with CIT Sydney. Even our taxiboat transfers were great from Airport to Hotel an Hotel to our Cruise ship Queen Victoria. Excellent Staff provided us with pleasant service at all times. Thoroughly recommend Liassidi Palace Hotel 4+ stars and not overly expensive for what you get. Would most certainly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: bam4ith
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room, but not looking onto the canal which I thought I had booked. But as another reviewer said you shouldn't be spending that much time in your room. The breakfast was wonderful, plenty of choices. The rooms were clean and comfortable. And every view in Venice is wonderful! We took the cheaper water bus from the airport and considered it like a tour of Venice until we got to our 'stop'. It was very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Mailmiya
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here based on my travel agent's recommendation. What a great place to stay in beautiful Venice. Very close the San Zaccharia vaporetto stop and the beautiful San Zaccharia church. The room was quite spacious for the three of us. The bathroom was very clean with a Jacuzzi in the tub. The morning breakfast was delicious with lots of choices. The coffee and hot chocolate was scrumptious. The hotel staff was very friendly. The first night our son was scared of the picture in the room and my husband requested the front desk to cover it. They were nice enough to remove it immediately. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Shame About The Size Of The Room”
Reviews.Author: jingga18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. It's a very nice boutique hotel but the room we got was extremely small. There's no room for maneuvering our bags at all. It was definitely the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed at albeit clean. Also, the air-conditioner was not working. It has pretty features, nice light-coloured decor. The view from our room was facing the lobby. I'm not sure if it has any elevators but we used the stairs. Its location is good - quite close to St Mark's Square. The staff's service is good and professional. Breakfast is average. It's not the best value for your money. If you'd like, go for the higher room type.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location in an amazing City”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: Number one tip: if you are arriving via Marco Polo airport do not even think of transferring to the Hotel other than by Water Taxi. Although a tad expensive (100 euros) it is the only way to travel and will get your stay off to a wonderful start. You'll be met by very friendly, efficient, staff at the Hotel's water door and be shown to a well decorated, spacious, comfortable room. Breakfast was good by Italian standards and even included bacon and eggs. Although the Hotel boasts a bar, the only evening we tried it, it seemed to be closed. There are plenty of spaces to sit and relax outside of your room, including a pleasant courtyard - but in a place like Venice you'd be daft to spend much time in your Hotel. Get out, get wandering and savouring this unique and wonderful car free city. Excellent though the facilities are, location is perhaps the Hotel's best selling point - a ten minute walk along canals and past shops and restaurants will get you to St Marks Square, rather less to the Riva degli Schiavoni where you can walk along the waterfront or catch a vaporetto. Gondola rides costing an arm and a leg are available even closer - you can't go to Venice and not try one. Despite proximity to the busiest areas, the Hotel was quiet and peaceful and the streets around it free from crowds. It was however the first sunny weekend of the year - we can't vouch for the state of the crowds in high season! Even in April, St Marks Square was crowded at times. In conclusion, you'll have guessed that we had a great time - Venice is unique but very expensive. We couldn't fault this hotel - although expensive by general standards, it was good value for Venice and the staff couldn't have been nicer nor more helpful. Unless you can run to the Cipriani - go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Absoluely fabulous. Happy to recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Coachgates
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have placed a review, but as I was so delighted with this hotel I feel I have to let others know about my experience. I stayed with my wife for three nights at the end of March. we were greeted by friendly reception staff who showed us to our room (105) where there was an ice bucket with complemntary Belini waiting for us. The room was beautiful and was finished in polished walnut wood. It was spotlessly clean and the ensuite truly sparkled. Our window opened onto the canal where we could view passing gondolas or other canal traffic. There was even a gondolier sitting on the bridge opposite. Breakfast was included in the price and was mainly continental style but there was always scrambled eggs and bacon as well as the usual coissants, cheese and ham. Although as usual, it was self service the helpful attendants brought copious hot coffee or tea within seconds of asking. The hotel was only 5 minutes walk from St Marcs square and similar to the water bus terminus of San Zaccaria. We asked staff on a few occasions for help about which was the best boat to catch and they knew the departure times off by heart, and even told us of connection times for journeys further affield. Were there any down sides? Well, If I was really nit picky I would mention that there was only a shower and no bath in the en suite, however it was a fancy shower that had nozzles down the sides as well as the usual overhead shower. Also there was a small amount of noise fron the activity on the canal in the mornings, but If you want a canal view then that is the price to pay. Even so we were able to sleep till 9am, so it wasn't that bad. The final slight niggle was that the re was supposed to be a bar available till midnight but one evening when we asked for 2 glasses of wine at 10 past 10 we were told that the bar was closed. Having said that when we looked disappointedly at the receptionist he offered to bring us what we asked for to the public area. We had extra large servings with a small bowl of salty snacks and when I asked to pay he said they were on the house. (I can't promise this will always be the case though) So all in all this was probably the best hotel I have stayed in for a very long time and happily recommend it. And for the record, I do not work for the hotel, or know anyone who works there. I am just a very satisfied traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Stay”
Reviews.Author: James1976
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at Liassidi Palace. The hotel was in a superb location. Breakfast was wonderful. We got a junior suite with a canal view and the room offered stunning views. Staff very friendly and went out of their way to help. Had read some negative reviews before and was a bit worried in case we made the wrong choice. This was proved unfounded. The hotel, it's location and service really made our trip an unforgettable one. Will be returning on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: izarauz
Reviews.Content: Venice is always a good choice, so hotel selection must be related tothe city splendour. This was the case with Liassidi, excellent location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet... The only thing we missed it was room service. After extensively walking throughout Venice we were exhausted and room service might been a good choice, but it might even be better we did not have it so that took us out for dinner and we discover another excellent restaurant. Venice, Venice, Venice....

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: LvTtravel
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and it exceeded our expectations. It definitely lived up to the name of its network "small luxury hotels". Location was wonderful -- right in the middle of everything. The staff could have been a bit more helpful but everyone was very friendly. I look forward to returning there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, quiet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aidw0rker
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and staff were friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast included in room rate. Room was basic, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit2011
Reviews.Content: The city of Venice is phenomenal, complicated and around every corner is a surprise. The hotel Lissidi Palace is off the beaten path. In other words, it is not located on the Grand Canal. With that said, it is not hard to find the hotel but be ready to go up and down the stairs crossing canals with your luggage. There are private water taxi's that will take you directly to the hotel but they can be pricey ($65). The Lissidi Palace Hotel is located in the Castello area a 15 minute walk NW of Piazza San Marco. From the main train station the public water taxi can take you (and your luggage) inexpensively to the San Marco stop and walk from there. A very comfortable hotel small central lobby but it has a large outdoor courtyard. The room on the second floor was roomy, elegant and had a nice view of a canal. Everything about the room was comfy and perfect for a day or days stay. The breakfast was a wide selection of foods both hot and cold. I thought the hotel staff very friendly and helpful with mapping any local destination. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and exclusive”
Reviews.Author: gooders_AUS
Reviews.Content: Stunning room (#205) with canal views, incredible presentation, impeccable service and very quiet and exclusive. Very impressive hotel with attentive staff. Breakfast service only. No room service but this is not an issue given there are so many wonderful restaurants in the very near vicinity. The staff seemed happy to be working there, and the stay was an absolute pleasure. Location is perfect as its just far enough away from the San Marco or Rialto "madness", and central enough for easy access to all shops and attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the name "Palace" says it all!”
Reviews.Author: shark28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in many hotels, in Italy for seven weeks, and this is a hotel you won't forget!..The service was outstanding the place was beyond a palace and they even upgraded us to magnificent!..............It was truly more than anyone could imagine. I told them that I would write a review and glad to keep my promise. They arranged for a taxi to the cruise ships and actually, a person couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: RICK063
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 weeks touring Italy's North beginning in Venice. What a way to start our trip. Venice was probably the highlight of our trip and our accomodation at the Liassidi Palace was superb. Sure an upgrade to a Junior suite ( without having to ask ) was a big reason for enjoying our stay, but everything else was first rate. Our room was beautifully clean, cool and comfortable. The service in the hotel was great and they couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. All our needs were catered for and the location was perfect, only a 5 min. walk from all the action but perfectly quiet at night to ensure a great nights sleep. Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. Rick.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: asalbogabhar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during an Italy tour...good location near St Marks and the ferry terminal. Upgraded to a suite with great views overlooking the canal...room itself was small but you dont go to Venice to stay in your hotel room!! Hotel provided a bottle of bubby on arrival which was a nice touch and staff were super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HappyMoonChild
Reviews.Content: You may find some similar hotels at this price but this hotel is where you feel the real Venice. They have tried to keep the decoration in Palace style and created a lovely combination. Despite its perfect location, we enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel which makes you feel at the center of Venice. And in the morning, it was great to have the breakfast in a cozy room with the large window looking to the side channel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location, a quiet haven, friendly and professional service"”
Reviews.Author: foodietraveller15
Reviews.Content: I had seen this hotel when I went to Venice years ago, and noted its great location, so was really pleased to get booked in this time. It is about 10 mins walk from St. Marks square, and only 5 mins from the main "seafront", so easy to get to the main attractions, but in a nice quiet spot and as Venice is so busy, you are really glad to get away. Another main attraction is that it has its own landing port so you can get a water taxi directly to and from the airport, which is pricey at 100 euros, but a real treat and super cool of course! All the staff were friendly and helpful, very professional, and helped us book restaurants etc. Our room was not the best - it was on the ground floor overlooking canal but from very little windows - not the big windows or balony others have mentionned. We didn't mind however as we got it for a reasonable price, we didn't spend much time there and the location of the hotel made up for it. But be aware if they are fully booked, you might be in one of the ground floor rooms with little view. Rooms were good quality though, spotlessly clean and fairly spacious. Would definitely return but maybe pay more for a better room, which would have made it perfect..We also loved the little Trattoria directly opposite, a lovely place to have lunch, friendly service, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GabiandToby
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Just 5 walking minutes away from Piazza San Marco. Our room in the fourth floor was fantastic. It had everything you want... air condition, minibar, tv (ok, a pretty small one... but who wants to watch TV in Venice?). The room was very quiet and spacious. The included breakfast was better than expected for a city hotel. I would definitively recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location but disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: ClaireHolland
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are wonderful - very friendly & helpful. The location is also good 10 minute walk to St Marks Square but in a quiet area with some good local restaurants. The public areas of the hotel are also very nice. I was however really disappointed with our room - it was small & very basic, not what I expected from a hotel which describes itself as luxury. I was especially surprised when reception said we had been upgraded!! I enjoyed our trip but would not pay the high rates we paid to stay here again, there are much more luxurious hotels in Venice for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: KarolineEngland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little gem of a hotel, efficient friendly service, modern, elegantly decorated rooms, exellent location, beautiful lounge! We felt immediately at home, we cannot wait to go back. The cutest hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - no other description needed”
Reviews.Author: lindacote
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights (pre-cruise) - welcomed warmly - given upgrade to suite 4th floor - nice touch. No view, but wasn't priority. Very quiet area - surprisingly as so close to San Marco Square (10 minute walk). Hotel has very nice lounge area on 4th Floor with tables and couches to read, play cards, talk,etc. Not necessary to entertain other guests in your room! Great restaurants across the canal from hotel good prices also for dinner, house wine was very good,reasonable price. Hotel only has breakfast included in rate, no other food service. Very nice breakfast room, good breakfast. Suggestion if arriving by public water transport at San Marco square - get a porter with trolley - very inexpensive rate (obviously depends on how much luggage) - you follow the porter with your luggage to the hotel- no getting lost at all - porters are excellent and are legitimately licensed! Water taxi to cruise port was very reasonably price. Negotiate all rides before taking - very important - prices really vary!

Reviews.Title: “Recently refurbished in a great location”
Reviews.Author: l4wsr
Reviews.Content: A lovely find, helpful and friendly staff, we had a junior suite with a balcony overlooking the canal. Clean and spacious room with spotless bathroom. Typical Continental breakfast served in its own room. Wonderful 2nd floor lounge overlooking the canal. This hotel is situated within an easy walk of all the sights but far enough away from the madness to feel part of the real Venice. Needs to get the bar sorted but other than that a great find.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ennyl3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little tricky to find if you have never been to Venice before but there are always lots of people on hand to ask for directions!. Once you find it you wont be disappointed. It is a 2 minute walk from the main pier and very close to St Marks square, yet positioned so that you wont be disturbed by any noise. The rooms are huge as well as luxurious and spotless. The breakfast, which is included in the price is a lovely buffet and the waiting staff are very attentive as are the reception staff. This is the first hotel i have stayed in (and i am well travelled) where i cannot find a fault. If you want to guarantee a great holiday in Venice, book the Liassidi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base and the best staff”
Reviews.Author: laurelchampion
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our second stay which was extended due to the volcanic ash. We stayed in a slightly bigger room -a junior suite. It looked out over an old building and garden so woke up to birdsong or church bells ringing- delightful. Not the traffic and police sirens wailing of other cities. You may be tempted to book a room to overlook the canal but you may get mosquito bites as well! This is so close to San Marco (turn right by Da Roberoto restaurant and keep going) and the vaparetto stops. I think it is an ideal place to base yourself. The hotel is lovely with a beaurtiful lounge area with some stunning artwork. Our biggest praise however must go to the staff who were just wonderful. They could not have been more helpful in seeing us through our predicament. They waived internet charges and substantially reduced the rate for our room after the date on which we should have departed and reduced it again as the delay became longer. The staff helped with phone calls, problems on the internet etc. Just brilliant. Found a great restaurant - Osteria Antico Giardinetto ,Calle dei Morti, Santa Croce. Everything homemade and delicious. The creamof chick pea and prawn soup might sound unusual but is fantastic. The chocolate mousse dessert is possibly the best I have ever had with added chocolate sauce and pieces of chocolae with strawberries. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, compact boutique hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: Boogso
Reviews.Content: Thought this four star would be a treat of our trip. The position is great, on a canal, and the hotel even has its own jetty for water taxis! Beautiful, historical building which added to the ambience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We felt a little disappointed in the size of our room, but it is in Venice, so not totally unheard of. The breakfast was good in range, including some hot items, muesli, fruit, toast, yoghurt. The staff were particularly helpful when we mentioned some problems with an odd noise in our room, and offered us, free of charge, a transfer to a canal view room, which was very generous and helpful!! Would definitely come back here and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL NEAR CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: jambo007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a excellent position ,comfortable,good breakfast.,in a wonderful city.lots to see and enjoy.Check out the local small Bars ,cheap and cheerful....watch for the cafes who charge when you sit down,just for the table. ..

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: pleasantrun1229
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Liassidi Palace for 4 nights. We were going to stay only three nights, but added a day because we loved Venice so much. Our room was nice and very clean. When we arrived, they upgraded us without our asking to a suite overlooking the canal. Throughout the stay, all of the staff were very friendly and accomodating with directions and suggestions, making dinner reservations for us, and generally making us feel at home. The hotel is a five minute walk from St. Mark's but off the main tourist route so it is quiet and secluded.

Reviews.Title: “Missed opportunity”
Reviews.Author: malou1001
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi Palace is at a great location not far off St. Marks and close to the San Zaccharia Vaporetto stop. It is located in a beautiful old building and has a very promising courtyard into which you step off the Ponte dei Greci. However inside the place is a mess. From a nice lobby you squeeze into a miserable lift/stairwell,the most beautiful Venetian salons are degraded into unused corridors defaced with absolutely dreadful art and the breakfast is served in a dingy basement instead. We might have booked wrongly and paid a price which was way too high (â‚¬ 250 p. night and double room) for what we got. Breakfast is substandard, Staff is either absent or mostly grumpy, the rooms are ok but disappointing given the potential of the building in which they are located. the interior design looks as though it had been done by the builders, the caterers or the dog.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kalougi
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Venice we were slightly apprehensive about finding this hotel, especially in the dark! Prior to our departure from the UK the staff at Liassidi Palace Hotel provided us with excellent instructions helping us find the hotel with ease. Although they gave us several options about how to reach the hotel from the Airport, we used the Alilaguna water bus (takes about an hour from the airport, costs â‚¬25 for return ticket), arriving at San Zaccaria (only a five minute walk to the hotel). The hotel is tucked away on a little canal, away from the tourist shops and crowds, although only a pleasant five minute walk from Piazza San Marco, and perfectly situated to explore Venice and reach all the main tourist sites. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite and enjoyed a spacious room with a king size bed, large bathroom and Jacuzzi bath. The room and hotel were spotless and serviced by very friendly staff. The complementary breakfast is served in a small light room overlooking the canal, and is full of everything you would expect in a continental breakfast, including pastries, Italian breads, meats and cheese. The Hotel does have a small bar (closed on Wednesdays), although no restaurant, however numerous restaurants are a stones throw away, serving delicious Italian cuisine. The hotel has been sympathetically renovated, and houses a splendid banquet hall on the second floor, which is a lovely place to sit and relax. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice; it is a hidden gem off the beaten tourist trail, which is a must for anyone wanting a romantic stay in an enchanting city. One more tipâ€¦ throw away your guidebook, it is impossible to get totally lost in Venice as you soon stumble upon the Grand Canal or Piazza San Marco, however (once you have your bearings), explore the little side streets and alleys, there are plenty of beautiful sites waiting to be discovered.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Myholidays1
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Venice in November and chose this hotel after looking at the tripadvisor reviews. Everything about the hotel was perfect, the service, room size (we had a suite), and cleanliness. The location was great for exploring, 5 minutes walk from the airport link boat station and also only 5 minutes from st Marks square. Despite the central location, the hotel was very quiet and you can not hear any noise from outside. Also, there is a pc in the lobby with a printer which is free to use - very handy for checking in online. The hotel has its own jetty, and offers a free water taxi ride to Murano. This is well worth doing as it includes a look in the glass factories. Just beware that the salesman are very pursuasive and so you need to be strong minded otherwise you will leave there spending 1500 euros on a vase. This was our first trip to Venice, and we loved it, such a beautiful place and November was a great time to visit, not too busy with tourists, no queues and not smelly.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel in Venice - without spending a fortune !”
Reviews.Author: gcUKNewForestEngland
Reviews.Content: Having spent months musing over the various reviews on TripAdvisor and booking, rebooking and then booking again various hotels, we eventually settled on the Lissidi Palace Hotel. We had some trepidation with some of the comments on the hotel trying to push it's own taxi services, selling trips to Murano and so on. Ignore all you read about that - I think that people must have been staying at a different hotel or, the hotel management have tightened down on this practice. We were absolutely delighted. This was our silver wedding anniversary so i wanted to ensure everything went well. I had booked a water taxi from the airport ( fabulous and worth every penny ) directly to the hotel. I had also prebooked the motor service from the terminal to the boat but didn't need it, the walk is all covered and takes less than 5 minutes. I'm not sure the taxi driver knew exactly where the hotel was as we ended up reversing the wrong way down one of the canals for about 300m to the front door of the hotel ! It all added to the fun ! Once in the hotel we were taken directly to our junior suite on the 4th floor overlooking the canal. I'm not sure about the comment about the lack of a lift - there's certainly a great little lift complete with seat. It's very slow but works perfectly well. The room was stunning with loads of room, great artwork, lovely view, an enormous bed and very well equipped bathroom. The only disappointment was a fairly old TV and only one armchair when there was plenty of room for 2. The hotel is quiet, beautiful and very well apppointed. The courtyard is lovely to sit out in in the evening. There is a bar but I don't think it gets used often but the desk staff will always open up and get hot or cold drinks for you without any fuss. Breakfasts were fine with a good selection of cold food and breads / pastries but with the ubiquitous scrambled eggs and streaky bacon as the only hot choice. Great views from the windows if you are lucky / early enough to get a window seat and the girls who work at breakfast are great and can't do enough for you. Opposite the hotel there are two small restaurants - litterally just over a small bridge and less than 30 seconds from the hotel. The food is great in both and very reasonably priced with a tourist menu at under â‚¬25 in each for three courses. It's about a 10 minute easy walk to the Piazza San Marco or only 5 minutes to the nearest vaparetto stop at San Zaccaria San Marco. From here you can get to all of the major sites with ease. We bought the 72 hours passes at â‚¬33 each and certainly got our money's worth. Take the #41 to Murano for your day trip to the glass factories and glass museum. The hop back on the 41 and it will take you all the way around the other side of Vanice, down by the railway station and then out into Canale della Giudecca for great sunset views as you approach San Marco again. DONT'S ? don't get caught out eating lunch or dinner at the Grand Canal side at Rialto Bridge. Stupid prices, rude service and awful food. Also don't worry about the floods between October and April - they're well used to it and deal with it very efficiently. For even more fun, invest in a pair of wellington boots for â‚¬20 and have fun watching the other tourists trying to balance along the raised walkways - especially as gthe Japanese tourists stop to take photos and create havoc ! Have a great time - we loved it !

Reviews.Title: “An old Palace with a modern look”
Reviews.Author: HappyMoonChild
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and there was an art show going on in our floor. Stuff were nice, friendly and helpful. We had made a mistake in our booking and arrived one day earlier. They kindly arranged the room for us without any extra charges. No lifts are available for the two floor building and our room was on the seond floor. The bathroom was very large and nice with massage system for the bath. They only problem was that there was no shower.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluecarrot
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in Venice, but this hotel was absolutely great!! The staff was very attentive and professional, the room was super clean, and the hotel was perfectly maintained and nicely decorated. We had a huge bathroom with a two-person tub, but it did lack a shower. The hotel is not quite as central as many reviewers here seem to think it is, but the fact of the matter is that you can walk from one end of the city to the other and back again in 45 min to an hour. I would strongly discourage anyone from following the hotels advice and taking the "vaporetto" (public transit boats) from the hotel unless walking is a serious problem for you. Walking from the hotel is very easy (given a good map and maybe a compass) and the vaproretto stop for the hotel is second to last, meaning an over-an-hour boat ride to get to the North end of the city (a ten minute walk). The breakfast was the largest one of our whole stay and had many great things to choose from that didnt seem to be on most of the hotels menus. As for the one review I read that said the breakfast was small with few options I would say that he must remember he is in Europe and breakfast is a bit different there. Compared to many other similarly priced hotels in Venice this one is a perfect gem and well worth the stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: BryanBerry
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, easy to find as it is not far from where the vaporetto drops you off from the airport. Beware if carrying a lot of luggage though as there are a few bridges to get over to get to it. A lovely outdoor area leads into the hotel. The staff are very nice and the rooms were bigger and nicer than expected. It came with free breakfast which helps on long days touring venice and it is located within easy walking distance of restaurants and the grand canal and st. Mark's square. Once you get your bearings in Venice, it is easy to get to but it really is a small palaces sitting on the canals. A wonderful stay in venice. Grazie.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this hotel to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Mariette1992
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really good. It was close to St. Marks square and Riva degli Schlavioni. When we arrived,we got a friendly welcome from the concierge at the front desk. And we must say that the hotel looked amazing. Many people that walked by the hotel said; ''Wow,that looks really expensive!'' Our room was a little small,but it was cleaned to times a day by the maid. The breakfast included eggs,bacon,croissants,fruit,juice,coffee,tea etc. While overlooking the canal,we enjoyed our breakfast. The hotel offers a trip to Murano,which is really nice. The people at the front desk are really helpful. We recommend this hotel to everyone! When we will go back to Venice(and we will,no doubt) we will return to Liassidi Palace as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel while visiting Italy”
Reviews.Author: jdpoland
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this place..the staff is warm and welcoming and fun and professional..the room was great and nice bath tub..they cleaned our room in the morning and when we left for the afternoon they cleaned it again..it was awesome! the mini bar was so cheap, it was smarter to drink the wine and beer out of it then to go outside. They took us on a private taxi to Burano and no charge..the breakfast was great, the front desk manager, Daniel is over the top a nice guy!! We were so happy to have finally found a good hotel during our 11 days in Italy..

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: bostontravelguy01880
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Venice in July. Yes July. After all the warnings about not going in the summer we went. We were so glad we did. Venice was awesome. The Liassidi Palace was amazing. Out taxi/boat dropped us right at the dock for the hotel. The lobby was very elegant. The room even more amazing. Very much a 5 star hotel. The hotel is very convienently sitauted.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationguysToronto
Reviews.Content: Arriving by water taxi right to the door of this charming hotel was a unique experience. We received a warm welcome at the dock as well as at the desk. Our rooms were ready and our luggage was promptly brought to us. The desk managers were most helpful to our friends whose luggage had been left at London Heathrow, and made numerous phone calls to the airlines to expedite the delivery of the luggage. They always welcomed us by name as we returned to the hotel through the quaint and inviting courtyard. Though small, our room was well furnished, clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was modern and well appointed. Nightly turn-down service and clean towels were provided. Breakfast included fresh fruit, juices, tea/coffee, cereals, breads and pastries, cold cuts. and cheeses. Staying at the Liassidi Palace enhanced our Venice experience and we would definitely stay here on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Totally Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: tonypay
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 1330 for a 1400 check in and were welcomed most cordially. Our bags were taken, we were invited to use any facilities we needed urgently (e,g. loos) and were about to go out for lunch but were called back as our room was ready early. All staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay of 3 nights. Our room was fine and taking breakfast overlooking the canal was very pleasant. Internet use was free. (Useful for checking in for return flights.) Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: GB01
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi Palace has two major things going for it - Its location and its staff, probably in that order. It is so close to St Mark's Square that you can almost fall out of bed into it (not really as its a few streets away but I did jog there in a few minutes on the Sunday morning and the Square - normally packed - was very quiet, so quiet that I sneaked a look in the Basilica through a back door whilst a service was on!). We booked via Airmiles (good) and travelled there with the Venice Guide and Boat Company (excellent). We arrived on our launch via the canal entrance (wonderful) and were checked into a downstairs bedroom next to the canal (awful - low beams and very dark). This was where the staff excelled. They changed us to a different room next day (quite small but light and airy) and they were attentive and helpful throughout the stay, especially those on the front desk. Breakfasts were good and filling although rather lacking in variety - strange serving lovely italian coffee in small white milk jugs? Again, good staff and attentive service. There is internet access in the lobby but not many places to relax. The bar didn't seem to open every night. Lots of restaurants in the vicinity. For getting around Venice and for being close to the sights, it was great and we can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay and experience”
Reviews.Author: izzy83
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel. Very well situated, close to st marks square but away from the hustle and bustle. Very helpful front desk staff that spoke excellent english. I travelled with a child and they had a cot ready for her and a high chair for breakfast. Very clean hotel. On the down side, not many chanels on tv that are in english, no in-room internet (however there is free in the lobby) and there is no room service (only breakfast). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Room Service”
Reviews.Author: GHL
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as its location and facilities met our requirements for a short 4 night break in Venice between 14-18 May. Unfortunately the hotel did not have a barman and as such not only did the bar remain shut but all room service was cancelled for the entire duration of our stay. The attitude of the local Director(Manager) was not at all helpful as staffing was outwith his control and recruitment was carried out by the Company. The hotel is ideally located for St Marks square which is a short walk away as are all the water buses. The buffet breakfast is adequate although not exciting and had the bar been open the courtyard would have been a pleasant place to have a drink after a days sightseeing. Not quite the same having a drink from the mini bar in your room. I think the staff had been getting quite a lot of grief about the lack of room service and the bar being closed so were perhaps not at their happiest.

Reviews.Title: “50th Celebration in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: 2travellingstones
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy on a land tour that included 4 nights in Venice, then we took the train to Florence for 3 nights, then we took the train to Rome for 4 nights. The trip was everything and more than I expected! Venice was where I really wanted to be for my birthday. The hotel was great! Booking a land tour you wonder what the room will be like. We had requested a view of the canal but didn't really expect to get it, well we did. It had two windows in the room that opened onto the canal. It was a handicapped room on the first floor. But alot of people say they prefer the hanicapped room because it is so much larger and it was. The bathroom was bigger and had a shower only but who cares! The breakfast was included each day and it was very nice and they changed it up a bit each day. Very attentive to your needs. The front desk staff was great and there was a waiter who worked in the outside patio that would bring you anything from drinks to snacks, he was great! My husband left his jacket in the room and we called from the water taxi when we were leaving and he said not to come back (as you can't just turn around in the canal you have to take another 45 minutes to go all the way around)so we would have missed our train. He said not to worry that he would send it through the mail. We we weren't home a week and it arrived! Got to love that service! I would go back for sure..check it out..it has a great location, just minutes from St. Marks Square...and restaurants. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a very decent rate”
Reviews.Author: Godflash
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at this hotel in March 2009. As the trip to Venice was to be a complete surprise for my wife I picked a hotel with very favorable ratings. We were not disappointed. On arrival we were immediately upgraded to a junior suite, without asking for it and without surcharge. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was equiped with the now famous jacuzzi in the bathtub. Hotel staff were very friendly and forth coming. We booked our stay through booking.com at a terrific rate of 138 Euro per night for the room. Money well spent! Dinner at nearby Oliva Nera was lovely, although not cheap. Excellent food and ditto service. We highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1700
Reviews.Content: I really canâ€™t say enough great things about this hotel. I spent two lovely nights here celebrating my birthday. I had a beautiful suite, it was very large with huge windows overlooking a canal. I couldnâ€™t get enough of the spa bath tub with the jets, after walking around on cobblestone my feet needed this luxury. I wish I could remember the names of the front desk staff, they were all extremely friendly and accommodating for all of our requests, the staff was the nicest of all the hotels I stayed at in Europe. I also really appreciated the free internet that they offer in the lobby, itâ€™s nice to easily check your flight status or email when you are on the road. My only complaint would have to be about the air conditioning; it was very weak and didnâ€™t cool the room. Thankfully we were there in October so AC wasnâ€™t as critical, but I could see it being a problem in July or August.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: skitg
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel designed as a palace. Easly reached by water taxi and the water bus. If u have a lot of bags recommend the taxi which stops directly at the hotel. Excellent room, location , service. The staff is simply excellent helpful with providing information and provide service at any time. Only european hotel which i have seen with a weighing scale. The rooms are neat , clean and the loaction is close to St. Marks Square which is an excellent location to be in. It is loacted in the Castello district of venice which has a lot of locals in addition to tourists so helps you to get a glimpse of the people. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RichH6109
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed at the Liassidi Palace Hotel in mid-April 2008. We wanted a centrally-located hotel for a reasonable rate (approx Â£150 per night) and the Liassidi Palace ticked both boxes. We were expecting a small, adequate room for use as a hub during our two-day stay in Venice with basic breakfast. On arrival we were shocked to be allocated a large, luxurious room on the ground floor with a bathroom big enough to be a room on its own. Although there was no real view of the outside (the windows we had faced another wall - as most do in Venice!), the size of the room more than made up for this shortcoming. Additionaly, the location of the hotel is convenient for the local water taxis and attractions but set far enough back to be away from the hustle and bustle of Piazza San Marco. Breakfast was also more than adequate although not as impressive as other hotels of a similar ilk. This hotel is deserving of it's "Small Luxury Hotel" classification and I would have no qualms in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accommodations and Location”
Reviews.Author: B&J144
Reviews.Content: We spent four glorious days at the Palazzo Liassidi in room #203. The junior suite was on two levelsâ€”A bathroom and sitting area on the first level and the bedroom in an upstairs loft. Our suite opened onto the very large sitting room on the second floor of the hotel, which was used an extension of the hotel lobby for gathering and relaxing. The staff was very formal and courteous, and truly made us feel as if we were guests in their home. We loved the location of the hotel, just a short walk from San Marco but away from all the noise and commotion. We hope to stay in the Palazzo Liassidi on all of our future trips to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a cruise”
Reviews.Author: 1_to_travel_on
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Venice one night after our 12 day cruise. I spent hours reading reviews and checking prices. Liassidi seemed to fit what I was looking for. Yes, it is expensive, but so is everything in Venice. We arrived at the hotel by private water taxi directly from the cruise port. FYI - we were told by the cruise line we would have to get to Piazzale Roma and then pick up the water taxi and that the taxi would only take us to St. Mark's square. Fortunately, the cruse line was wrong. We were able to get a water taxi right outside the cruise terminal and it took us all the way to the hotel. It was 80 euro, but well worth it with all the luggage for door to door service. We arrived before check-in, but the staff was friendly, took in our luggage, gave us a map, and offered us a complimentary water taxi to Murano. They seem to have an arrangement with a particular showroom. We were met by a guide, given a glassblowing demonstration, then a tour of the showroom. It is a nice treat, but also a good opportunity for you to spend money that you might not have planned on spending. Make sure you have them take you back to St. Marks or the hotel, if they take you to Burano you'll be on your own for getting back and it is a 1.5 hour vaporetto ride - found that out the hard way and it put a real damper on the day. When we returned we were shown to our room and they brought our luggage up quickly. Within minutes we were off and running again and thanks to the great directions from the front desk we didn't get lost. Our room faced the courtyard which was nice and quiet. The room itself was nice sized for Europe and clean. There were only 2 English TV channels available, CNN and MTV. We weren't in the room much so this wasn't a real issue. The location was great for getting close to everything, but far enough away from the crowds. The hotel arranged for our water taxi to the airport. - 90 euro. While this is the easiest way, it isn't exactly door to door. When you arrive by water, there is about a 10 minute walk to the terminal. There are porters there, but we hadn't budgeted for that - we were trying to have just the right amount of euro to get out of the country. Overall, the stay was the perfect end to a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo, well apart from the 'hot' breakfast items”
Reviews.Author: Egremontonian
Reviews.Content: We booked the Liassidi Palace after my partner came across the website, it looked like a really nice hotel and it was. We arrived by water taxi (yeah expensive, but as an experience it cannot be beaten) and so entered the hotel from the canal. One early word of warning is that if you arrive by the normal waterbus routes then make sure you approach the hotel from the San Marco side as from the Castello side it would be very hard to find. We had booked a junior suite (read large room), not all of these have views but we were delighted to be informed that we had been upgraded to a junior suite with a canal view (Room 405 to be exact). The whole booking in was very swift and very courteous, we were shown to our room and then our bags transported for us. The room, like the entire hotel, was very clean and modern in style but with touches of the old - we had a reproduction Klimt in the room. The bathroom was bright and airy and as well as a shower (which proved to be excellent) there was also a spa bath. One really great touch was that waiting for us in the room was a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and some crisps and nibbles, giving my partner a free bottle of her favourite wine definitely scored major points. Throughout the stay we found the staff friendly and the standard of cleanliness was beyond reproach. The bed, as always on the continent, was two singles pushed together, but at least they seemed to be joined together and in truth the join was barely noticeable. The location of the hotel was very good, only a 5-10 minute stroll from Piazza San Marco and only a little longer to the Rialto bridge. There were two restaurants on the opposite side of the canal, one of which, Il Conchiglea, we used on our first night, it was not inexpensive but the food was very good. We also made use of the nearby Crazy Bar (which is more like a small cafe, though they do serve beers and other alcohol) on a couple of occasions, the Espresso is definitely worth having - be aware that this place seemed to close at about 6pm. If you wander away from the Rio Di Greci (the canal that fronts the hotel) then there are some interesting shops, including real ones used by Venetians, such as a butchers and a barbers. So, to sum up, we found the hotel accommodation to be of a very high standard with really nothing that we could fault, but there is one thing that stops it getting the full 5 marks - breakfast, or to be more precise the hot items. If you stick to the cold items at breakfast then you will have no complaints - the really fussy will make comment that the juices come from a carton - in fact many of the cold items, such as the croissant and the cold meats, were very nice and there was a decent selection of cereals. If, however, you decide to start your day with Pancetta and scrambled eggs then be prepared for, at best, lukewarm food. The eggs and bacon are placed in a metal roll fronted serving container that has a few table lights placed underneath it in a vain attempt to keep them warm. It struck us that this was something that could have been remedied quite easily so I am afraid it costs the hotel a point, I would dock it half a point but tripadvisor doesn't do half points! But, please don't let the not hot 'hot' breakfast items stop you staying at the hotel, it is certainly a hotel that we would hope to stay at on any future return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie0865
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Easter with my parents. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We had booked a double and a twin room and the 1st night my Mum and Dad found the room a little noisy. They mentioned the problem to reception and immediately they were moved (upgraded ) to another room which was quieter. Our room was small but had everything you needed, mini bar , TV etc and the bathroom was lovely with a jacuzzi bath. There were little extras as well, slippers, shampoo etc which added extra luxury to the stay. Each night the bed was turned down and the sheets and towels changed daily. Breakfast was nice in a room adjacent to the canel. The hotel has it's own landing for the water boats. No wonder this hotel is a small luxury hotel of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and gracious”
Reviews.Author: Eaden
Reviews.Content: We've been meaning to stay at the Liassidi Palace ever since it opened as a hotel five years ago. I'm delighted to say that it lived up to our expectations, and surpassed them in many ways. We had a room overlooking the canal - and although that is a bit noisy with local traffic in the morning, that's part of the charm. I think the canal is a bit of a "rat run" for locals avoiding the main grand canal - and all the more fun for it as a way of watching life. The room was light and clean and nicely furnished and had a jacuzzi - which was a good way of easing sore feet, but a bit eccentric to get into. The staff were very kind, polite and helpful, particularly at the front desk. Breakfasts were nice and the breakfast room overlooks the canal. I had a reasonable meal - unlike other reviewers in the Greco restaurant over the canal - it's cheap and cheerful and has a good set menu. But if you want a real gourmet experience, go for the L'olivo nera (sorry about my spelling) behind the hotel. I've been going there for five years and have never had a bad meal - I particularly love the fish (a Japanese chef who really respects it, combined with Italian flavours, a real winner). It's not cheap - and olive oil and the strawberry desert wine and the 25 year balsamic vinegar are excellent and make great souvenirs. Do drop in to the Greek Scuola right next door (this is the original greek area) and have a look at the Icons - it's where El Greco trained as a painter.

Reviews.Title: “Very Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Liassidi twice now and we will be back in November... The hotel is our number one hotel and we have stayed in a lot... the staff are very welcoming and we have never had any issues... the rooms are bright and airy and extremely clean... avoid the restaurant opposite the canal though as i could make better pasta in the kitchen at home... it is only a short walk to St.Marks and it is really easy to get back to when you have been out all day... the breakfast staff are really nice and helpful even the cleaners are friendly... the front of house staff have all been there on both occasions we stayed at the hotel and they are extremely helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kitttykat
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi palace is a gorgeous hotel tucked away in a great location close to St Marks square. The hotel staff were friendly and very attentive. We were however given the room that was directly behind the staff desk which was a bit dingy and the main problem was the noise from the room above and the plumbing was extremely loud. We told the management who offered to move us to a different room the following day, but after realising the room was fairly quiet at night decided wasnt worth changing rooms as really only in there to sleep at night after all. Having said that the room was the largest we stayed at in Italy. The breakfast was good with a selection of cereals, pastries, fruit, bacon & eggs offered. The coffee was not great by Italian standards. We took advantage of the free water taxi to Murano if you are interested but if you want to buy glass sculptures (standard styles) I'd suggest purchasing from back in Venice island as you will be able to get a better price for the same items. We follow the directions on the website and found the hotel easily. Although even with a map we got hopelessly lost wandering around venice but that is half the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: strollingtrini
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute reservation as I had booked the Courtyard Marriott but found it to be too far. This was a recommendation at the last minute booth at the train station and it was excellent. This hotel had an excellent location, phenomenal staff and the amenities were the best. Stay here and enjoy - it is really embodies the small leading hotels of the world group that it is a member of.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff were fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rmgavin
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room and it really was worth it! The location is excellent and the staff and accomodation exceeded our expectations as hotels in Italy aren't normally to the standard of other countries. They are very helpful and can recommend classical events etc. that are worht going to and organise the tickets for you. October a great time to go as not to busy and weather held out well. I looked in at some of the other hotels I had shortlisted and felt I had made the right choice. To get there easist (and cheapest) way is to get No.1 vaparetto down Grand Canal to San Zaccaria stop after St. Marks Square. Young couple from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Quite Haven in a Very Busy City”
Reviews.Author: JMorel
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Liassidi. The staff is wonderful, the hotel is quite, clean and very comfortable.It is close to many beautiful sights yet away from the crowds. There are wonderful resturants very near. We felt that the Osteria Oliva Nera was as delicious as the French Laundry in the Napa Valley. If you take a trip to Morano the hotel offers a complamentery trip and we had a great meal off the main street a place called # 1. Venice is beautiful and this hotel makes it even more enjoyable. The breakfast is just OK they do not have a real kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louiseUS
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15-year-old daughter and I stayed here July 19-21, 2007. The hotel is beautiful and the front desk staff were extremely helpful, kind and thoughtful. It is located only minutes from St. Marco's Square and yet in a quiet location between 2 smaller canals (at each end) with many restaurants and services nearby. Our room (triple) on the 2nd floor was great and off a large palatial drawing room. Papers were available to scan in the front lobby and there was free internet. The complimentary breakfast was fine (fruits, yogurt, so/so eggs, croissants). It is a small luxury hotel, and we would stay here again in a minute without hesitation! We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel, great front desk”
Reviews.Author: wdavis4000
Reviews.Content: Of all our hotels on our Italy trip, this was the best. Close to St. Marks but off the busy waterfront. The hotel itself looks newly remodled, with A/C that actually works well. A free computer in the lobby for internet use is provided. We were in an superior room on the fourth floor and were completely satisfied with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: db70disco
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at the Liassidi palace hotel in Venice and the best part of the hotel was the location. It's right off a smaller canal in Venice, within walking distance to St. Mark's square. There is a great little bridge right outside the hotel and restaurants right across the way. The hotel also offered a free water taxi out to the island of Murano to see the glass factory which we would highly recommend doing. We were given the handicapped room on the main floor right behind the desk which was an enormous room but there was noise from the check in desk. In addition to that the beds were a bit hard for our taste. Those are really the only reasons we wouldn't give it a 5 out of 5. The location couldn't have been better and if you make sure you don't get the handicapped room (unless you need it) I think you will be pleased. You can upgrade to a room with a view which we didn't do, so if it's not much more to do so, it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky interior”
Reviews.Author: StockholmStockholm
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and beautiful exterior but the interior was extremely tacky. A perfect example of a beautiful palace that has been totally destroyed when renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Liassidi!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sashi0604
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 3rd to May 7th 2007. The hotel in my opinion is exactly what it says it is, a small luxury hotel. The room was small but the new furnishings and overall layout helped us feel more comfortable. The bathroom was new and spacious and had every creature comfort for a hotel room including a scale and slippers. The hotel staff and front desk were incredibly helpful and nice. The internet point was free and convenient considering no other hotel we stayed in had it for free. The breakfast was okay..perfect for free in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again. The location was a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGirlTraveling
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location to stay in Venice! I can't recommend this place enough (and I stayed in a lot of hotels in Italy). Since it was our first time in Venice, we had no idea where to stay when we booked this hotel through trip advisor. The location was perfect and the staff was wonderful. Our room was beautiful and very clean. We stayed in a double room with the whirlpool tub. It was a very large room and bath, which is hard to find in Europe. The hotel takes a while to get to by public water taxi, but it is so worth it. If you can, call ahead to the hotel and arrange a private taxi for a quicker and more direct route to the hotel. The breakfast was also really nice and had a lot of tastey items. One benifit to staying at this hotel is that we got a free private water taxi ride and tour of an amazing glass factory on the the island of Murano. Be sure to ask about it. Also ask about local restaurants-this hotel recommended some amazing places. I will definately stay at this hotel the next time i'm back in Venice. P.S. The view of the water at sunset is priceless!

Reviews.Title: “A splendid hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PMORENO
Reviews.Content: We first booked a standard double room, but I was committed to give to my wife the best impression on Venice (she had always dreamed of visiting this city) so after Claudio, the hotel manager told me the only rooms with a view over the "canal" where the Suites, then I upgraded to a Junior Suite (supplement of 100â‚¬ ). I do recognize It is a impressive room with a fantastic bathroom and a beautiful view over the channel. Also we get a bottle of wine in the room. Who could ask for more? The hotel is a magnificent example of the Venetian stile of life, with "arlequino" style floors, clean and well run with a friendly staff. The location is also very convenient, as you only need less than ten minutes to get to the San Marcos Square. In all a very nice little gem in Venice, and my wife has keep in her memory a vivid and romantic image of the city. Pedro J. Moreno

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Liassidi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiaWestSussex
Reviews.Content: The Liassidi was not our first choice but turned out to be an excellent hotel. The service was faultless, the rooms (we changed room with no fuss at all) and bathrooms were perfect, the location was easy for going anywhere. The restaurant only serves breakfast, which was beautifully presented, so we just had to sample the restaurants nearby where we struck lucky too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgmtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Liassidi last January. The hotel is quite new if compared to the average. This is maybe the point that makes it tacky. Furniture and paintings are brand new replicas, what sounds very fake. Above that it's comfortable, and service is good. Breakfast is weak, considering it's a Small Luxury Hotels member. Location is good, behind St Mark's square. A bit difficult to reach though if you arrive by vaporetto and have large suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
