Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with excellent and efficient staff. Location was great, 5 mins from St Marks Square and value for money excellent. Minus points: No bath in the room only a shower (which didn't drain properly)and our room (12) was quite cold. There is also no restaurant or bar in the hotel, only a breakfast room. Plus points: Great staff who gave us good tips on where to go and what to see. Our room was really big and very quiet. Lovely location in the heart of the city. Would definitely stay again, the many good points def made up for the very few negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: vikkifish
Reviews.Content: we had checked in to another hotel which was terribly dissapointing for a four star. My husband went for a walk and saw the lovely entrance to the Liassidi palace. The reception offered us an excellent price, and we cheched out of the other hotel. What a marvellous place! The staff were very friendly for such a posh hotel and they welcomed our two young children. They saved our holiday and I can not recommend them highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alimoon
Reviews.Content: we just got back from The Liassidi Palace, we took the ACTV boat from Marco Polo Airport that dropped us off at the Zaccaria stop, from there it was only a couple of blocks (which of course we got a bit lost, but then we find that is one the fun parts of travelling to a different country). the hotel's courtyard is very charming, with huge umbrellas and tables with chairs, we didn't really hang out there since the weather was cold and a little rainy. our room was abosolutely gorgeous, overlooking the canal, a huge corner room with windows all around. by American standards the room was HUGE, we could not believe it. a jacuzzi tub/shower, all amenities in the bathroom, including slippers, bath salts, etc. the whole staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. the location was magnificent, probably a ten minute walk (if that) to St. Marks Square. 2 restuarants across the canal, but there are so many little bars/restaurants everywhere, there was no problem finding a place to eat. we are already thinking of going back and staying there again. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Could do Better!”
Reviews.Author: Skymarshall
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the 'Liassidi Palace' chosen for our wedding anniversary and will say that the building is picture postcard Venice (especially from the canal if approached by water-taxi) and it's location is also excellent for sight seeing. Rooms are clean and smart with the illusion of Venetian style and opulence being created by use of an obviously reasonable maintenance and decor budget, although room layouts may not be as functional as they might first appear. Breakfast is good in as far as continental style is concerned, with cereals, sliced meat, cheeses and scrambled eggs also readily available. A small but little used bar may be open early evening, but then later on appears to be dependant upon whether any staff are in attendance or not and cannot be guaranteed. There is a lack of services normally associated with most other 4 star hotels, such as tea and coffee making facilities, on-site restaurant, room service, lounge areas (other than hallways), entertainment and also the distinct lack of compulsory hotel atmosphere. Guests will seldom get the opportunity to meet and discuss daily experiences over a relaxed pre-dinner aperitif, as all meals and evening entertainment is only to be found outside the hotel in other establishments or in the city itself. Staff are helpful and polite, although why 6no reception staff (at last count and at varying times) are needed, when no other services are available, did seem very strange. Several requests made prior to our arrival for flowers and wine to be provided in the room, were also conveniently ignored. We had an absolutely fantastic time in Venice, probably due to visiting outside of the main tourist season and found enough superb (and expensive) restaurants to keep us occupied in the evenings. However, if you want to put your feet up after a hard days sight-seeing and really don't want to walk for your Dinner, make sure you book a hotel with full facilities elsewhere in the city. In essence, the Liassidi is a very expensive and smart 'Bed and Breakfast' establishment which provides a very comfortable and quiet base for exploring Venice. The hotel may deserve accolades for style and quality, but should not be recommended as a 4 star hotel due to the overall lack of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Does size matter?”
Reviews.Author: croakey
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from 4 night stay at Liassidi Palace. Service , cleanliness and attention to detail was brilliant, front desk team ever helpful, location as good as the other reviews said it was and we'd rate the place as an excellent base for visiting Venice. But...breakfast was no better than adequate and the room we were allocated was both the smallest and with the lowest ceiling we have ever experienced. If you're over 5 feet 10 tall or suffer from claustrophobia, dont go for room 303! Some of the other rooms looked fantastic, but we didn't realise until we'd booked that standard and superior rooms were so markedly different in size. To find the hotel use the instructions from Expedia, they're spot on and we found it easily. Transport from Marco Polo airport using the Alilaguna ferry worked well and for 12 Euro pp each way was a real bargain. Eating out was easy with loads of choice - try Robertos in Campo san Provolo. Staff speak good english, really friendly and a good range of food and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exceptionally clean and beautiful. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Unlike other reviewers, the boat ride to Murano was never mentioned to us, but we never really encountered the manager Claudio. The location of the hotel is perfect! True, it is a short walk to St. Mark's Square, but the distance is what allows this hotel to be so tranquil and quiet. We booked through Expedia and received a decent rate (by Venice standards, mind you!). We are pretty convinced we received one of the smallest rooms in the hotel because we went through Expedia. Even at that, the room was well appointed, beautiful, and quiet. Our windows overlooked a courtyard. People need to understand that rooms in Venice run on the smaller side, anyway. Space is very limited there! :} The courtyard is a pleasant place to have pre-dinner drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, clean!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel212
Reviews.Content: We were booked for a night at the Londra Palace, but when we arrived, we were told that their air conditioning had broken and we were unable to stay there. I was freaking out (we had made these reservations 8 months ago, and miraculously, our friends were given a room!), but it ended up working out just fine. They had made arrangements for us at the Liassidi Palace, and we paid 80 Euros less for a much nicer room. We had a complimentary bottle of champagne and some munchies on our table, and a nice view of a canal from the window. The staff was courteous and helpful. It was about an 8 minute walk from St. Mark's Square, which really wasn't a big deal at all. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2690
Reviews.Content: Great hotel away from the crowds! Beautiful! Nice comfortable rooms and great breakfast. Staff was very helpful and extremely nice. Definitely a great place to stay and explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: |Lara&Sofia'sMum
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here as a treat before I returned to work after having twin girls, that were safely at home with Gran parents. The hotel was great, the only fly in the ointment was my partner getting lost for 6 hours in Venice with no money, sense of direction or brains. The hotel were great, they looked after me, called the police and other hotels to see if he had been found wandering, which he had! Obviously he had sore feet after all that walking and the room we had was perfect, a big Jacuzzi bath to soak in. I would definetly recommend this hotel, and the fab breakfast. If you have money I would suggest a water taxi from the airport that can drop you right at the hotel door, what a way to arrive! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: justjkp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best!!! 5 of us stayed for 2 nights in June. Our room was bi-level with the bed upstairs and the living area and bathroom downstairs. The room was comfortable and clean. One of the best beds we had in Italy and we stayed at 7 different hotels. The staff was so helpful for dinner recommendations and getting the boat to the Murano. The location is great with a restaurant and little bar just across from the hotel. I would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cocotti
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the beggining of April and we were more than delighted... The room was beautiful very spacious with all kind of modern facilities, canal view and the bathroom was big with also hydromassage shower... Venetian style mixed with modern very very clean and new The staff was helpful and always smiling. The breakfast was SUBLIME... Position EXCELENT... I would reccomend this hotel for anniversary honemooners, special occasion... a great hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At Liassid Palace”
Reviews.Author: JackieElderslie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned this afternoon what a lovely hotel. Went with my teenage daughter. We stayed in room 201 which was large for the two of us. It is a beautiful room. Nothing was any trouble for the staff and they were so helpful. We walked and walked went on boats and even went by bus to the market for a euro - it is so cheap to travel around. We took the free trip to Murano which was by private water taxi which my daughter loved. Had a quick tour then look at the glass and the shop no pressure to buy then they gave us a water taxi back. It was a great way to spend and hour and a half. This hotel is worth going to. Central easy to find everything on hand and it was so nice to return to after exploring. The only down side was there was no tea or coffee making facilities it would have been good to have that so I just had to make do with some wine!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tokyo-venice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liassidi at the end of March. After reading the reviews I was not sure if we would like the hotel or not. But the rooms looked nice on their website and seemed more contemporary than other hotels that we saw on the web. So we went with some trepidation and low expectations. But we were pleasantly surprised at the nice hotel. We made reservations via their web site. They had a great winter campaign, first two days of our stay at full price and all other days at half price. I think this campaign is over. The room was nice, much larger than we thought it would be, including the bathroom. But then again we are not 6 ft. tall so what may seem roomy to us may be just average or small to others. The hotel does not have a restaurant so it does not offer room service. The breakfast buffet was fine, croissants&pastries, toast, cereals, scrambled eggs, ham, cheeses, yoghurt, fruit juice, fruit and coffee. Nothing extrodinary but more than sufficient. A good beginning for a long day of walking through the streets of Venice. We were offered the Murano visit but we declined as you can easily get there on your own via the vaporetto. The staff were nice, always with a smile. We researched Venice extensively so we did not have to ask the staff any information but they did seem friendly. I would have no problems recommending this hotel as long as one does not have great expectations. One reviewer compared this hotel to the Bauer and the Grand Monaco, but these hotels will cost you an arm and a leg. I believe that this hotel is fine for its price level, but then again I do not know the peak season price levels. The location is good as it is close by the San Marco Piazza and also to the vaporetto. All in all a good hotel. As you can tell by the mixed reviews this hotel is not perfect. We at least had a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! Well worth it's 4* rating.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liassidi for 4 nights and as we hadn't been to Venice before, we didn't have any expectations of the mixed reviews we had seen on this hotel. I chose the Liassidi because of how nice the bedrooms looked on the internet with the Venician style and what a great find it was! We arrived after finding it easily, (once you get to know that streets are actually alleyways and very narrow ones at that, with a squeeze when 2 people are passing each other). The greeting was very welcoming and the dreaded Claudio (from previous reviews) was nowhere to be seen. We were advised of the time for breakfast and given a map of venice and we were offered a trip to Murano glass factory, but we declined, because we weren't interested in the trip. We were then shown our room (No.107) by the receptionist, and the porter followed with our luggage. The room was very impressive, with a hall and the bedroom and bathroom had their own separate entrances off the hall, so it felt more like a junior suite rather than a superior double. We overlooked the lovely courtyard area, which is refreshing to see in Venice, as most hotel entrances only have doorways. The room was clean and we were never disturbed by housekeeping, as the staff always knew when you left the hotel because we were requested to hand the room key to reception every time we left. The bed was remade each evening and 2 chocolates were laid out beside the bed, which was a nice touch. Breakfast was well above expectations, there was above average choice of a hotel with 26 rooms. Pastries, toast, cereals, scrambled eggs, ham/meats, choice of 4 cheeses,fruit, biscuits, yoghurt, 4 types of fruitjuice, preserves, tea/coffee and the breakfast staff were attentive and we never had to ask for anything else, as the breakfast was always replenished before running low on food. The location was ideal, with a 2 min walk to the water bus stop S.Zaccaria, 5 mins walk to Piazza S.Marco. There was too much choice of restaurants, but we enjoyed our meal at the Marco Polo on Salizzada S.Lio and our favourite bar was the Bacari Jazz opposite the Central Poste at the Rialto bridge, which had a generous choice of cocktails and food(but we didn't eat there, we just had our prosecco)with friendly staff. We were also surprised at how good the room rate was. We had perused various internet sites for the best room rate including Expedia, but when I looked on the Liassidi Palace Hotel website, there was a special rate request, we were then advised that if you stay 4 nights you receive the 3rd & 4th night 1/2 price, so in total we paid 570 euros for a superior double including breakfast for 4 nights stay. Which was lower than any other website was offering! When we return to Venice, we would definitely stay at the Liassidi hotel, as everything about the hotel was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “We will return !”
Reviews.Author: 2006paul2006
Reviews.Content: The reviews are mixed on this site and rightly so, on the basis that everyone has an opinion on what a 4* hotel should offer. The hotel didnâ€™t have a bar by the looks of it, the breakfast rooms are fairly small and the staff are as responsive as the customers own enthusiasm! However, in our opinion the location was excellent, the service of the highest degree, the accommodation and the hotel itself was spotless! If you require room service, hotel bar, restaurant then this isnâ€™t the place for you! I feel the hotel is more plush bed and breakfast, which caters exceptionally well for the independent traveller. We stayed in Venice as the annual Carnival commenced. In our opinion, the hotel is far enough away from the bustling San Marco square, without loosing the atmosphere that is Venice. The hotel is tricky to find, but due to Venice's creative street naming/layout this is something you will have to address(excuse the pun, throughout your stay. Our room had a mezzanine level and was spotless throughout. The beds were extremely comfy and everything was to hand. We did have a whirlpool bath and after walking the length and breadth of Venice, it was indeed most welcomed! The hotel staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay and were always willing to help if greeted with courtesy and a smile ! The will happily recommend restaurants, things to see and do and provide you with an insiders guide to Venice. We did take up the free water taxi to Murano (It definitely wasnâ€™t forced upon us), which is worth a visit. Do remember that the staff at Murano are employed to sell and do try their best to ensure you part with your money. The goods are of the highest calibre.......... but the prices reflect this ! We will be returning and we definitely will stay at the Liassidi palace !

Reviews.Title: “Below average and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: dirkthecow
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to attract a mix of gushing and damning reviews on Tripadvisor. On booking I listened to the former, sadly from my experiences the latter may be more accurate. Unlike some posters, I didn't experience any problems with the staff. I encountered Claudio, but had no problems with him. The boat trip to Murano wasn't pushed down our throats as I had feared beforehand. However, for a 4* hotel, this place has a surprising lack of facilities. Actually it has no facilities. It says it has a bar, but we couldn't see one open. No room service (or none advertised). Two small breakfast rooms with a really below par buffet. It doesn't even have a public toilet - after storing our bags after checking out we were sent to the first floor where there is a small toilet that the staff use! I really wonder how this place got its star rating or got onto the small luxury hotels lists - surely you need to meet a certain minimum standard of what you offer guests? What it does have is an abundance of public areas which are hired out for conferences and seminars. One was taking place immediately outside our room on the second day we were there. We booked the most expensive room on offer at the time, a "suite" for 390 euros with a canal view. Really, this was a large room rather than a suite, but my understanding is that room sizes are generally small in Venice anyway. It certainly wasn't worth the money though. Especially since the "suite" had a bathroom that could only be described as very compact. Yes, the room had a jacuzzi bath (or a standard bathtub with jets - not the corner bath featured on the site), but it was postively liliputlian in size. I'm 6"1 and of average build and had real problems squeezing in. Venice is a beautiful place and our experience at the Liassidi Palace in no way ruined our stay in the city. However, on walking towards the grand canal I did pass a variety of hotels that I previously considered staying at - the Luna Baglioni, the Bauer and the Monaco. I wish I had. On all accounts they are not only better. Incredibly, they would have cost me the same or have even been cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and i booked in jan last year to stay at this hotel and sadly had to cancel due to family illness. Despite cancelling in line with the hotels cancellation policy (which you aren't able to see at the time of booking) and the hotels assurance that we could change the date of our stay with "no problem" or any chargeI the hotel then took an unauthorised payment from a credit card. Throughout, ongoing discussions with the hotel their attitude has been rude and condescending I would not under any circumstances book directly with this hotel and want to warn everone of their business practices. ( The legality of this transaction is currently being investigated by the Financial Ombudsman Service in the UK)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: babeyrachel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2004. The hotel is in a FANTASTIC location - 5 minutes max from St Mark's Square and certainly within walking distance of everywhere you may want to go in Venice. The staff were extremely friendly - even when we arrived at 1am. Everywhere was extremely clean and well presented. The all you can eat breakfast buffet was fantastic - not only was there a wide variety of excellent quality food but you could sit and watch as the water in the canal came up to the window. The only downside was that the 'superior room' booked on Expedia was fairly small and did not have the jacuzzi bath mentioned on some other posts. However we paid around Â£250 for a three night stay which still seemed good value for a great hotel in a great location in a great city. I would highly recommend this hotel and should I ever find myself back in Venice I woudl definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my mum to Venice for a surprise for her birthday. I booked this hotel through Expedia and then was really worried when I read some of the reviews on this site describing the problems that reviewers had had with rooms booked in this way. It was especially lovely therefore to be welcomed on our arrival by charming, helpful staff and find ourselves in a big room, overlooking the canal, with a large bathroom. The hotel itself is tucked away - part of its charm - but within a very short walk of many attractions and the courtyard is delightful, really good for a summer visit, but there were guests sitting out in it even in November! Everybody we came across in the hotel was friendly - including the other guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Liassidi Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybride2be
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Venice. We stayed at the Liassidi Palace, which we would thoroughly recommend to other travellers. It is close to San Marco but in a quiet area, which we appreciated. The hotel staff treated us very well and had a complimentary bottle of prosecco waiting in our room on arrival, which we enjoyed, and it prompted my boyfriend to propose! We will always remember this hotel fondly. If I'm lucky enough to return to Venice we would rebook without a doubt. It is a very good four star hotel, with a few special touches that make it unique and a cut above a standard 4 star. After reading some of the other reviews on this site I was wary of booking via Expedia, so booked directly with the hotel, and they offered a competitive rate and were very prompt and helpful with the booking. Our room was on the small side, like several others we have seen in European city hotels. The breakfast was okay, I've had better when travelling, but it was varied, included in the price and gave you a good start to the day. THe room itself was well decorated in a modern style and well maintained, particularly the bathroom, and we appreciated the turn down service, which you don't often find in hotels any more. The bathtub was a jacuzzi tub, which was nice. There was also a beautiful reading room on the 2nd floor and a nice courtyard outside the hotel. Because Venice is on water there are lots of mosquitos, so bring your spray. There is a good restaurant down the short passageway (away from San Marco) which we visited 3 times, and were always treated well by the staff. AFter the first visit to the San Marco area for dinner, I avoided the restaurants around the Piazza. We strolled into this area one evening and were disappointed by the quality of food, it is very touristy and while our food was inexpensive, we paid three times the amount for a bottle of prosecco that we had bought earlier at lunch. Venice itself is fantastic, make sure to visit Piazza san Marco, the Doge's Palace, The Guggenheim collection, and Accademia. We also took advantage of the 3 day and 1 day vaparetto passes, which we thought were good value for money and also allowed us a romantic trip up the Grande Canal. One thing to bear in mind is that Venice is not the easiest city to get to. Make sure you add plenty of time to transfer from the airport to the city and vice versa if you want to do it the less expensive way. You can take the bus to the Piazzale roma and then a vaparetto to the nearest stop to your hotel, wherever it may be, and don't forget you then have to carry your luggage down various side streets, over passenger bridges etc to get to the hotel. We almost missed our flight back home!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but don't trust them. Claudio is back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in early September 2005 for several nights. Here are my quick thoughts: Very difficult to find, but that might be most hotels in Venice. It was not well marked and off a little alley. However, no one seem to know of the property either. Room Layout: The suite #202 we had had an upstairs room that was so warm, it was a sauna. I can't imagine what it would be like in a hot summer. It would be unusable. As soon as you come into the room, you have stairs going up. This would not be for everyone. We had to watch our oldest traveler closely because the floor is all glass and she slipped down twice. Cleanliness: Overall the room was clean. Breakfast: It was beyond mediocre, once the 'buffet' was depleted it was not refreshed, eggs cold and croissants slightly stale.Finally, we would concur with a previous reviewer that the staff attitude leaves a lot to be desired. I don't recall a hello or good morning at any breakfast during our visit. Staff: Patrizia was very helpful with the check in and made us feel welcomed. However, that's where it stopped. The Manager Claudio tried to charge a 50$ extra offering an upgrading already included in the booking. They were useless for finding info on trains, museum access or other information (Concierge Jacky). The only restaurants they could recommend was their own some distance away.We were less than enamoured of a number of staff, and an arrangement they appear to have with a glass factory on a neighboring island. Before we had time to draw breath we were offered a free trip across the lagoon which we foolishly accepted. It resulted in an escorted and rather uncomfortable tour of a glass factory.We faced heavy sales pressure to buy something from the showroom. We spent 3 minutes watching glass being made and 30 minutes winding through a maze of showrooms with a salesperson. No fun.Don't take it! Claudio was particularly rude, even for Italian standards. I noticed that he had disagreements with many guests who came to the front desk.As we checked out, another couple was there with similar complaints so I'm hoping they listen. Basically, stay at the Liassidi Palace for an easy walk to San Marco Square, but don't book anything through them! You need to research before you go and bring a guidebook you trust. Or you can sign up for walking tours/boat tours and ask those people for advice. Anyone but the hotel staff. I'll stay somewhere else next time, because I feel so ripped off from last trip. It's a great property but needs some work on staffing above all the Manager Claudio.

Reviews.Title: “A WOW hotel overlooking a quiet canal and calle.”
Reviews.Author: iluvitaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here having booked through Go-today. The hotel we wanted (and got) in Rome was paired with this, so it was not our choice, it just worked out that way. Were we surprised and delighted! We couldn't believe our luck when we found the open courtyard at the entrance to this fantastic, recently entirely renovated, hotel. The rooms are modern, the baths are sleek with jacuzzi tubs, the public rooms on each floor are spacious with sofas, tables, paintings and lots of light. The included breakfast was excellent and the front desk staff helpful. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBLondon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from 3 nights at the Liassidi palace Hotel. We loved the hotel, but decided to upgrade to a larger room with a beautiful view (room 106). I decided to pay the extra 40 euros per night for the privilege! It was worth it. Lovely large room with 2 windows looking over the canal. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a quieter part of the city away from most of the crowds. We tried to avoid the San Marco and Rialto areas where most of the tourists were and headed into the back streets of Dorsoduro (lovely), Zattere, Cannaregio. Found some lovely restaurants: in particular La Zucca in Sante Croce. Caught the water taxi back to the airport, well worth it (90 euros). We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Claudio and Expedia bookings...”
Reviews.Author: Rivendell
Reviews.Content: I want to start this review off with a warning â€“ beware of Claudio at reception and his no class attempt to scam you into a 50 Euro upgrade. My cousin and I had reserved a superior twin room through Expedia and immediately upon arrival he tried to hardsell the upgrade. We turned it down and were then shown to what was supposed to be the room we had booked â€“ right behind reception! It was an awful room. While it was quite large, it felt like being in someoneâ€™s dark, musty basement. There was no bath or bidet, just a shower with assemble-yourself doors. It was room #10 so if you are checking in and thatâ€™s what they try to give you, say no immediately. We were in the room no more than 10 minutes when we started hearing tons of noise above us and from the plumbing. We were very disappointed so we promptly asked to be changed to another room. Wouldnâ€™t you know it, there were none available until the next day. Claudio got very defensive and tried to convince us that this awful room was in fact a junior suite and better than what we had booked. I think they just overbooked for that night and tried to pretend that this crappy room was a superior room. Uh, no. Based on some posts by others here, it seems this hotel does not try too hard to please its Expedia customers. In my opinion, if a hotel has a better room available, they should upgrade people for free. There are plenty of postings on this website by people who were upgraded free of charge at other hotels. Now the next day, when we changed to a proper room, #404 on the top floor, things improved dramatically. This room was very nice and exactly what I had hoped for. The pictures I have posted are from this room. It had a large, bright bathroom with a big tub and lots of room to move around the beds. As for the service, every other person who worked at reception was wonderful. We had no further problems. One bad apple almost spoiled our visit. The included breakfast was the worst of our three hotels in Italy but had a big enough variety for me. The best improvement they could make would be to switch from the Tang colored fake OJ to the real thing. The breakfast room is right at canal level so it provides for interesting sights. My last morning there I saw a funeral procession go by with a coffin in one boat and mourners in the next one. Strange but I guess normal for Venice. Although it was one of the things that sold me on this hotel, I never wound up using the courtyard. It sits between the street and reception so it gave me a fishbowl feeling. Itâ€™s hard to relax when people keep walking by and gawking in at you! The location is ideal for those who want to be near San Marco. The crowds were a real turn off during the day but the evenings were really lovely. We had a nice meal in a restaurant in San Stefano square. Itâ€™s a pleasant 10 min. walk west of San Marco. I would return to this hotel only if I booked a specific room directly with the hotel. I would not take my chances with Expedia again. Because we only enjoyed three of our 4 nights I have rated this hotel as average instead of above average.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Liassidi”
Reviews.Author: ErinPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Liassidi Palace for only 1 night, on our way back through Venice. We loved the location of the hotel, very close to San Marco ( at most a 5 minute walk ) but not right there. The hotel itself is very pretty, the courtyard area, the lobby, and our room was definitely the largest and nicest we had while in Italy. The front desk was very helpful. Right when we checked in they told us there was going to be a water bus strike the next day ( we needed to get to the airport) so they helped us arrange transport right away. There is a complimentary breakfast - definitely was not the best we had, but they do have both hot and cold food items. One thing about restaurants I would recommend is to go check out other areas. We had stayed up near Ca d'Oro earlier in our trip and loved the restaurants up that way - we did not enjoy the restaurants in this area. Probably too close to San Marco because they were way too touristy. I would definitely recommend doing a boat tour of Murano, Burano, and Torcello - we really enjoyed it and Burano is the cutest little place. Colorful fishing village with alot of character - and not the crowds as found in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Liassidi Palace, what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, we booked three non-smoking rooms, requesting king sized beds in each. We may have had larger rooms in other hotels but they were all OK with interesting headboards! The courtyard is a lovely place for an evening drink before going out to find somewhere to eat - lots of good places within a few minutes walk. The reception staff were excellent, polite and very helpful, the barman also was very good. Breakfast was great, plenty of choices to eat. The position of the hotel is quiet but not far from San Marco without the bustle of closer places. Short walk from San Zaccaria landing stage if you arrive by vaporetto, only 10 euros each from San Marco airport but it took 90 minutes as it stops at lots of places, great if you aren't in a hurry! The reception staff booked us a water taxi for our return to Marco Polo airport and being collected from the hotel's own landing stage was really classy! Worth the 100 Euros price for 6 people and luggage as it only took 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Did like the Liassidi Palace”
Reviews.Author: tucsonishome
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this very nice hotel. Our room was a junior suite # 405 that had a view of the canal and a restaurant. The room was a nice size with three windows with lots of light. We had no problems with the mosquitos since we figured out how to work the air conditioner and never really opened the windows. We did end up paying 420 euros a night and I am not sure it was quite worth the money. Our room was always clean, we just did not find the staff to be all that friendly. The breakfast was ok, nothing special but enough to start your day. Again, the staff was not very friendly. The location is very good with about a 5 minute walk to the square. I would recommend this hotel. I would also recommend that you take a water taxi to and from the hotel to the airport. It is expensive but worth not to hassle dragging your luggage around. One other things that I did like about this hotel is that the security after a certain hour at night is very good. To get into the hotel you must press a buzzer that a staff member at the front desk opens up to the gate of their courtyard and entrance of the hotel lobby only if he knows that you are a guest at the hotel. They keep your picture at the front desk so they know when you are coming and going. The great tubs are wonderful after a long day of walking!

Reviews.Title: “nice but few gripes”
Reviews.Author: mckinneyuk
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel in may for my birthday. Hotel was nice but we had same problem as prevous review. We booked through expedia and because it was a double birthday we treated ourselves to the superior double. very impressed when we arrived via water taxi from treviso airport ( flights 49p each) When we checked in our first disapointment was that the 2 rooms booked were not together. When shown our rooms they were tiny. we went to reception and they showed us rooms we could change to it was interconnecting rooms with 1 door which was not suitable. we were then offered to upgrade to what we had booked for 100 euros per room per night. we decided to stay put and take it up with expedia when we returned home. Waiting there reply. Hotel staff were good rooms clean and in very good location for st marks square. watch out for mosquitos in room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice..but reality check time!”
Reviews.Author: daglesj
Reviews.Content: Ok, its time to make folks aware of a potential problem with this hotel that seems to have been hinted at in another recent review. We read the reviews and thought we couldnt lose on this one. It seems whenever we book a hotel with Expedia we get a bad room even if we book an upgrade etc. So this time we booked a 'Superior Room' at extra cost, we arrived via a water taxi to the hotel in the afternoon (well worth doing) and all looked good so far. We were shown to our room (we were expecting a room like the superior shown in the pics) only to find the room had a sitting area about 8 feet square, one window that faced a brick wall and the bed was nowhere to be seen. I looked to my left to see a very angular brass and glass staircase going up the side of the room. There, perched at the top on what looked like a shelf was the bed. Never seen anything like it! Ok it was clean and modern but very dangerous at 4am if nature calls. So thinking about the Superior room pics, we did the very un-British thing and complained (well, politely asked to make sure we had a superior room and to change it). They confirmed yes, we had a Superior room but would show us another two rooms. The second room was a conventional room, nice but gloomy with no view again (this happens a lot in Venice on lower floors). The third room we were shown was the actual 'Superior Room' in the pics. Great, we thought. Only to be told that was 50 euros extra per night! So what was this room then? An extra extra Superior room? So we choose the second. It was only after we moved our bags that we realised it was two singles pushed together (they couldnt be joined) and the new room was significantly cheaper than our original 'faux' Superior. By then we were too tired to take it further and decided to agree to being 'dissapointed'. You can draw your own conclusions as to what is going on there. Other than that the stay was fine, a couple of other minor gripes were one day we came back to our room about 2pm to find it hadnt been cleaned. Tired and hot, we just grumbled, sat down and the maid appeared, so we had to clear out again. The other gripe was the bar wasnt always open for a nitecap in the evening after we came back from dinner. Its a nice hotel with polite and friendly staff but just watch yourselves. There is no such thing as perfection. Oh and we were not offered a refund on the cheaper room. We are not complainers as a rule but we thought we'd just point out what happend to us. You will love Venice though...we did!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my wife out for our "second honey moon" after being housebound for the past 5 years with our two toddlers. Since I wanted something romantic what better place than Venice ! Stayed from May 25 - 28, 2005 and paid Euro 800 in total for three nights, inclusive of everything. I selected this hotel based on the reviews on this site and want to thank everyone for their candid comments. Allow me to share how our visit went and I will start with the points for improvement and then the compliments: We stayed in a double superior room overlooking the courtyard (room 108). (i) First thing we noticed when we entered the room was that there were many mosquitos in the room which I managed to 'neturalise' within a 2 minute hunt (also very noticable was that in addition to my effort there were about half a dozen other mosquito kill stains throughout the room by othe guest. - hotel needs to do a better job of cleaning the walls, etc or repaint them. I don't understand why there are no mesh screens for lovely windows in the room, afterall this is Venice (built on a swamp and surrounded by water) and mosquitos are not uncommon - so we didn't open the windows. (ii) We couldn't figure out how to turn on the airconditioner but when I attempted to call reception for help, there was no directory in my room or on the phone...so after a number of random attempts, I dialed '9' and reached reception, and asked how to turn on the airconditioner. The receptionist said it was very complicated and sent up a bell boy to my room who arrived very quickly and after we both examined the airconditioner for about 2 minutes and played with the dials, we jointly figured out how to turn it on ! ! However, the airconditioner is a separate floor unit attached to the window - not a problem until you close your curtains at night, at which point the beautiful thick curtains completely enclose the airconditioning unit on all three sides such that no cool air gets out - so my advice is that you either leave your curtains open at night or you crank up the aircon. to the max for about 15 minutes before you close the curtains, and then leave the curtains half open so that some cool air circulates the room. (iii) the cleaning people do a great job in keeping the rooms very clean; however, for our last 2 days, the cleaning people left a dirty rag visibly in the room and bathroom. (iv) Room was very small - I've travelled quite a bit and I was surprised that my room was smaller than that I experienced in Japan; however, I understand that the suites are much larger and so if you want space, you should book a suite and not a room. (iv) web-site for the hotel indicated that there was modem socket which I mistakenly assumed was a high speed internet connection - what they meant was you can "dial-up" to the internet the old fashion way (however they do have one computer in the reception area at high speed where you can surf the net. (v) I sat down to do some work at the desk; however, the height of the desk was in excess of the chair seat height - I'm 5'10 and the desk came up to my chest when seated... so don't plan on doing any work in the room unless you can find a few phone books to boost the chair height. (vi) Service - (see positive comments below). What really disappointed me was that on the night before and on the day of our departure we were asking for directions to the airport, the best type of transport, etc and whilst we recieved the right advice, what we didn't know but apparently the rest of Italy knew in advance was that the airport traffic controllers in all of Italy, on the day of our departure, would be staging a strike on that day ! ! Now it is clearly my fault for not re-checking with the airline but you would think that a hotel with only 26 rooms and classified as 4 star would take a little bit of initiative to inform their out of town guest of this critical piece of information, especially as I was checking out in the late morning and re-checking my directions to the airport. Needless to say that really disappointed us and you can imagine what happened at the airport with a thousand people trying to get new flights, etc. Positive points - a very clean hotel (in spite of the mosquito kill marks) and as others have mentioned, decorated very tastefully and I must say, cool ! Breakfast was simple, but very tasty (but bring your own ketchup cause they don't provide it). People - overall the staff were friendly and accomodating. One of the best reception areas I have seen for a boutique hotel and a fantastic courtyard (small but cozy) where you can hangout and relax. Great location and I felt very secure. On balance, a sound hotel, but for the price we paid and for the 4 star ranking, somewhat disappointing for the reasons stated above....that's why I give it an average ranking overall.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: dottyp
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from 3 nights at this hotel - a surprise 50th birthday present for my hubby. We had a fantasic room (junior suite) on the 4th floor overlooking the canal - pricey but worth every penny as it was for a special birthday. [Wish we'd seen the last review before we left as the mosquitos certainly had a party - didn't ruin our stay thanks to some magic potion from the local farmacia!] The staff were very friendly but did tend to push the water taxi and free trip to Murano - our suggestion is get the 3 day waterbus pass @ â‚¬22 and do your own thing. We will definitely go back but maybe opt for a less expensive room but now knowing the layout I would be particular about which room I booked. I have sympathy with the traveller from Harrow as I felt that some of the rooms could be suspect. We had a fantastic 2Â½days in Venice, the weather was excellent - plans are already being made to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my partner, who is now my fiance! Thanks Babe. Had a lovely time, hotel is very well furnished, excellent location and staff very helpful (the maid cleaned the room every time we left it). Would definetly reccomend this hotel, if you get a room with a view it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. As previous reviewers have said, the location was excellant, only about a 5 minute stroll from the square, but in a peaceful location. The room we had was beautifully furnished, although it would have been nice to have a canal view. Just be prepared if you are going here, the mosquitoes are vicious, ask the hotel staff to put a vapouriser in your room, otherwise bites will ruin your stay. We had a lovely time, and I hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: flyerkites
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of February. Lovely room, great hotel, excellent location, breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Good breakfast. Lovely views. Great room. Luxurious. Charming. Can't fault it.

HotelInfo.Name: Liassidi Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Castello Ponte Dei Greci 3405 | Venice Island, 30122 Venice, Italy
